question: What is the theme of the 2018 International Day of Peace?
option1: Partnerships for Peace – Dignity for All
option2: Together for Peace: Respect, Safety and Dignity for All
option4: The Right to Peace - The Universal Declaration of Human Rights at 70
answer: The Right to Peace - The Universal Declaration of Human Rights at 70
explanation: The International Day of Peace is observed every year on 21 September to strengthen the ideals of peace, both within and among all nations and peoples. Established in 1981 by unanimous United Nations resolution, Peace Day provides a globally shared date for all humanity to commit to Peace above all differences and to contribute to building a Culture of Peace. The 2018 theme “The Right to Peace - The Universal Declaration of Human Rights at 70” is celebrating the 70th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
